intro: Tetraria punctoria, commonly known as the punctured tetraria, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Tetraria punctoria is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family.
